ClassDesc: The main entry point for Google Wallet integration. You need to build a @B_com#google#android#gms#common#api#GoogleApiClient_E@ using the @B_com#google#android#gms#wallet#Wallet#API_E@ and the appropriate @B_com#google#android#gms#wallet#Wallet#WalletOptions_E@. Once you have called @B_com#google#android#gms#common#api#GoogleApiClient#connect_E@ and your listener has received the @B_com#google#android#gms#common#api#GoogleApiClient#ConnectionCallbacks#onConnected_E@ callback, then you can call the various Wallet APIs. When your app is done using Wallet, call @B_com#google#android#gms#common#api#GoogleApiClient#disconnect_E@, even if the async result from @B_com#google#android#gms#common#api#GoogleApiClient#connect_E@ has not yet been delivered. You should instantiate an instance of @B_com#google#android#gms#common#api#GoogleApiClient_E@ in your Activity's @B_android#app#Activity#onCreate_E@ method and then call @B_com#google#android#gms#common#api#GoogleApiClient#connect_E@ in @B_android#app#Activity#onStart_E@ and @B_com#google#android#gms#common#api#GoogleApiClient#disconnect_E@ in @B_android#app#Activity#onStop_E@, regardless of the state. For comments and requirements specific to different Wallet APIs, please see each API interface's header comments.
